sub_title: Cross-Disciplinary University Lecturer for Environmental Economics, International Law & Social Psychology | Consultant, Author and Public Speaker | Multi-Potentiate Synergist
summary:
Chad Patrick Osorio is an international academic, lawyer and economist advocating for human and environmental rights.

Chad is current Sandwich PhD candidate at Wageningen University and Research, the Netherlands, under the Environmental Economics and Natural Resources (ENR) and LAW Chair Groups. As a full scholar of the French government, Chad graduated at the top of his class with a Master II Business, Law and Economics from L'Université d'Aix-Marseille, mention très bien. He received a Juris Doctor & a BA Psychology degree, cum laude, from the University of the Philippines Diliman. 

Chad won 1st place in the Professional Category of  the Peter Drucker Challenge 2022, invited on an all-expense paid trip to Vienna, Austria to receive the award. He was also finalist of the same competition in 2020 in the student division. In 2017, he was hailed as the first Filipino recipient of the Eisaku Sato Award for Brilliance, a global essay competition supported by the United Nations University and Prime Minister Sato’s Nobel Peace Prize. He is contributing author to a number of int'l publications, including the Asia-Pacific Yearbook of International Humanitarian Law and the Palgrave Encyclopaedia of Global Security Studies.

Chad has been invited to speak at various int'l events, notably for the Int'l Conference on Human Rights and Peace & Conflict (Thailand), ASEAN Youth Leaders' Ass'n (Viet Nam), & Asian Development Bank (Japan), among many others. He has given guest lectures for the PH's top higher education institutions.

Chad has been awarded the 2015 Gawad Felicisimo T. San Luis for the Most Outstanding Youth of Laguna & the 2018 Huwarang Kabataang Lumbeño (Exemplary Youth Award).  He is also an int'l award-winning photographer, his works on exhibit at Harvard Law School, as well as at the 2017 UN Conference of Parties in Bonn, Germany, among others. 

In 2022, Chad was named Global AI Ambassador by SwissCognitive, World-Leading AI Network. At the same time, he teaches university and training courses on International Law, Intermediate Economics, Criminal Psychology, and Legal Terminology, among others. 

He devotes his spare time volunteering in underserved, underprivileged communities.

awards.title: Huwarang Kabataang Lumbeño (Exemplary Youth Award)
awards.issuer: Municipality of Lumban, Republic of the Philippines

awards.title: Award for Brilliance
awards.description:
Eisaku Sato was former Japanese Prime Minister and the only Japanese laureate of the Nobel Peace Prize. The Essay Competition was established in 1980 in commemoration of his achievement, and held annually since the 1990s.

The contest has no restrictions as to age, nationality or profession. In the past 6 years, the youngest winner was 19 years old, and the oldest, 77.  Many past winners are graduate students, but some stand out, including an Administrative Vice-Minister of Defense of Japan.

authors.headline: Cross-Disciplinary University Lecturer for Environmental Economics, International Law & Social Psychology | Consultant, Author and Public Speaker | Multi-Potentiate Synergist

profile_positions.description:
• Spearheads initiatives in bridging young high achievers from all over the world willing to volunteer as speakers, trainors and facilitators in events and activities geared towards communities and groups based in developing countries and underprivileged communities
• Key roles include external relations and network building, events planning and facilitation, and short-term and long-term project implementation, among others
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder

profile_positions.description: • As Senior Lecturer for UPLB’s Department of Economics, handles intermediate environmental economics (Econ 170), intermediate microeconomic theory (Econ 102) and special topics in Economics focused on Economic Analysis of Law (Econ 191), along with the recitation class for its introductory course (Econ 11), discussing various topics in the field with the aim of further understanding theory and applicability in industry and advocacy praxis
profile_positions.title: Senior Lecturer

profile_positions.description:
• Provides comprehensive advisory opinion on matters concerning business transactions, claim liabilities, and rights and obligations under existing contractual relationships, as well as business-related legislations, rulings and regulations
• Reviews legal documents, such as contracts, patent applications, pleadings, leases, and the like
• Assists in domestic and foreign market growth and expansion, including necessary liaison work with government agencies
profile_positions.title: Strategic Legal and Business Operations Consultant

profile_positions.description:
• Conducts course counselling and tutorial for students of Legal Terminology, Criminal Psychology and Introduction to Forensic Science
• Writes, edits & proofreads education material for course notes and promotional materials pertaining to the aforementioned fields of interest
profile_positions.title: Academic Officer

profile_positions.description:
• As Chief Legal Officer, responsible for the over-all legal direction of Sociov
• As majority stockholder and member of the Board of Directors, provides insights for key business strategies, essential partnerships and growth opportunities for the company within the coaching and mentoring industry
profile_positions.title: Chief Legal Officer

profile_positions.description:
• Assisted and advised students in preparation for their Bachelor's Program thesis at the Department of International Studies, College of Arts and Sciences
• Topics range from international trade law, agriculture and the ASEAN, to natural resources extraction and human rights, to information and communication technologies (ICTs) and artificial intelligence (AI)
profile_positions.title: Thesis Adviser, International Studies

profile_positions.description:
• Spearheads thought leadership pieces on sustainable and equitable economic and social development through AI + ML 
• Collaborates on various projects and programs with fellow Global AI Ambassadors from six continents on  creating understanding, trust and acceptance, and driving further development of Artificial Intelligence
profile_positions.title: Global AI Ambassador 2022

profile_positions.description:
ALPHA10X is AI that connects the people, capital, and ideas that promise to solve the world's greatest challenges.

• Prepared daily and weekly intelligencers, as well as end-of-month highlights, on highly-relevant micro and macro economic and policy developments in the intersections of artificial intelligence, life sciences, and investments
• Provided secondary research support as required
profile_positions.title: External Consultant

profile_positions.description:
• Spearheaded the general economic R&D framework as well as privacy, legal risk and security analysis for the enterprise, taking into account both micro and macro economics and international policy landscape analysis
• Prepared weekly intelligencers on market deep dives, product-market fit enhancements, and competitor analysis, among others
• Handled international investor relations assistance, including report preparation and continuous engagement
• Provided strategic knowledge support for product development, programme management, legal and finance
profile_positions.title: Head Of Research

profile_positions.description:
• Spearheaded the formulation and implementation of general student activities for IMS-Rome End of the Year Activities and Summer Program, including liaison work with national and international entities and organizations, embassies and consulates, to foster holistic student development
• Assisted in the general administration of the school, primarily aspects related to legal matters, international correspondence, and finance
profile_positions.title: International Activities Coordinator

profile_positions.description: • As professorial lecturer for UNO-R School of Law, handled the introductory course on Public International Law, tackling domestic and foreign policy, global standards and international law enforcement, especially regarding various transnational issues including trade-related matters, environmental protection, technology & connectivity, and fundamental human rights
profile_positions.title: Professorial Lecturer, Public International Law
